intro: Morinda deplanchei, commonly known as the African angelica, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright orange-red berries that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Its ornamental value and medicinal properties make it a notable species in its native region.
